projectPurpose: To provide a high-performance Python library for creating, manipulating, and analyzing graphs and networks by implementing core components in Rust.
mainFeatures: High performance graph library for Python
Implemented in Rust for performance and safety
Support for shortest paths, isomorphism, matching, and multithreading

alternatives.name: NetworkX
mainFeatures: Supports various graph types (directed, undirected, multigraphs, weighted)

alternatives.name: igraph
mainFeatures: Bindings for R, Python, and C

alternatives.name: graph-tool
mainFeatures: High performance (C++ core, Boost Graph Library)
Efficient filtering of vertices and edges

alternatives.name: NetworKit
mainFeatures: Includes a breadth of graph algorithms

marketPositioning: Rustworkx is positioned as a high-performance Python graph library. It directly addresses the performance limitations of pure-Python libraries like NetworkX by leveraging the speed and memory safety of Rust. It competes with other high-performance libraries like igraph and graph-tool, offering a balance between Python's ease of use and compiled code's efficiency, particularly suitable for performance-sensitive applications and large-scale graph analysis.
